bullets.text: Deep learning powers applications like Google Translate and image grouping.
It is a subset of machine learning, which is a subset of artificial intelligence.
AI mimics human behavior, ML achieves AI through data-trained algorithms.
Deep learning is inspired by the structure of the human brain, using artificial neural networks.
Machine learning requires explicit feature definition (e.g., size, stem for objects).
Deep learning's neural networks automatically pick out features without human interference.
This independence in deep learning comes at the cost of requiring a much higher volume of data.
Neural networks can identify complex patterns, like handwritten digits.
An image (e.g., 28x28 pixels) is fed as input to neurons in the first layer.
The network consists of an input layer, hidden layers, and an output layer.
Information transfers between layers via weighted channels.
Each neuron processes information by adding a bias to the weighted sum of inputs, then applying an activation function.
Activated neurons pass information forward, and weights/biases are adjusted during training.
Customer support: Enables realistic conversational bots.
Medical care: Detects cancer cells and analyzes MRI images.
Self-driving cars: A reality with companies like Apple, Tesla, and Nissan.
Data volume: Requires massive amounts of data for effective training.
Computational power: Needs expensive Graphical Processing Units (GPUs) with thousands of cores.
Training time: Deep neural networks can take hours or even months to train, depending on data and layers.
Popular frameworks include TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, and Caffe.
Deep learning and AI are still in early stages, with vast future potential.
Innovations like devices for the blind using deep learning and computer vision are emerging.
Replicating the human mind may soon move from science fiction to reality.
